review_detail.title: Total Scam. Stopped Working after 6 Weeks. Awful Support from Samsung.
review_detail.content: When I pay $700, a TV should work, especially longer than 2 weeks. I bought a Samsung TV from Amazon that stopped working after only 6 weeks. Samsung support made me wait for over an hour while they walked me through lots of troubleshooting things – nothing worked. They then wanted me to schedule a technician to come work on the TV, but only during the morning or afternoon which are not options for me since I have to work. No other solution was offered, so, I got on Amazon support and they allowed me to return the TV for a full refund since Samsung offered no viable option. I will never purchase another Samsung TV since it (1) didn't work after only 6 weeks and (2) their support ultimately offered no customer-centric solutions. It's too bad. Hopefully Samsung will revisit how they want customers to experience their products and brand.

review_detail.author: I call them as I see em.
review_detail.title: Poor deep colors, flesh tones, and contrast, drag the UN75NU80 down to subpar.
review_detail.content: I have a really old Samsung LED LN52A650 with the good panel. It's like 9 years old. The colors on it are still life like (nice deep dark,or realistic vibrant colors). I cannot tune the colors on the UN75NU8 to get anywhere near as nice. For some reason, the geniuses at Sumsung left out the ability to get to all the color settings in custom mode, but available only when in HDR.  I actually thought the whole intention of having an HDR+ mode was to not have to adjust the colors.  So why they offer them on in HDR+ mode, and not in the custom mode, I have no idea. And these settings do no good in HDR+ because it just tunes the colors all wrong (maybe the panel isn't tune for the US set?). So with no ability to set the white balance, and other color levels (not talking about the Red and Green slide setting) the colors cannot be adjusted (especially the greens). So you cannot get good flesh tones right, or light tans. Faces are too white, or too magenta. While the pictures looks great in the store, once you get past the big picture, and the soap opera motion, the tv just don't make a compelling reason to get it over my old set.  I will probably just send it back and keep my 9 year till it blows up (well, hopefully it will last just long enough to let me tune my next tv's color to its high standards).

review_detail.author: William Iaconis
review_detail.title: High Quality Features at a Reasonable Price
review_detail.content: Let me start by saying that I have a house full of expensive TVs, including the 2017 Q7 series that I paid $2600 for. I can honestly say that this TV rivals that one, and at a fraction of the price. The colors on this TV are absolutely stunning. It's 4k HDR, so you get the full array of saturated colors that are typical of high dynamic range. That doesn't apply only to HDR compatible games and movies, because even standard 4k and 1080p colors are rich and vibrant. The cord hiding feature is also amazing. There are channels leading to all of the inputs on the back of the TV, which in turn runs into the base itself, so all of your cords aren't actually exposed until they exit out of the back of the TV stand. The remote is also streamlined and good quality, with rubberized buttons and voice control. The bezel on this TV is also extremely thin, much like a smartphone bezel. Setup was an absolute breeze, with full on-screen commands and ethereal background music to guide you through smoothly and quickly. The soundconnect feature instantly detected my Samsung soundbar, and it connected wireless and seamlessly, automatically powering the soundbar on and off with the TV. There is honestly nothing bad I can say about this TV. I love every feature of it.

Product: Samsung 65NU8000 Flat 65” 4K UHD 8 Series Smart TV 2018

review_detail.author: Mark Magik
review_detail.title: So clear...I feel like I am there!!
review_detail.content: This TV is so amazing...I love it. The clarity of the picture is super clear and makes me feel like I am actually there. I am seeing details in movies I have watched 10's of times that I have never noticed before. Such an eye opening experience watching this TV. The picture quality and watching experience is so good my wife actually stays awake and finishes the movies with me now....a rare experience in the past. The physical design is so nicely designed that I hardly notice it. The user interface is excellent but I would love to have a dark mode for nighttime viewing as it is super bright and striking when the menu is activated and hard to look at in the dark but by no means is it a deal breaker. Smart TV functions have everything I need for a basic core experience but a few more apps and channels would be really great. On that note it does pair up with my external digital streaming device but I was unable to pair the remote correctly so I could use just one remote...someday I will figure it out and bliss will follow. The remote is wonderfully sleek, easy to use, has impressive around-the-corner range and it's only drawback is accidentally sitting on it has taken me far from where I was watching in a split second, much to the great confusion of all watching. It was super easy to set up, both physically and digitally and takes up very little footprint compared to my old tv. I look forward to wall mounting it eventually but I almost feel like I don't need to at all. All-in-all a perfect addition to my digital watching experience. I LOVE IT.

Product: Samsung 65NU8000 Flat 65” 4K UHD 8 Series Smart TV 2018

review_detail.author: ART J
review_detail.title: Defective product and not very cusomer friendly support
review_detail.content: This TV arrived with a irregular black spot on the left top of the screen with vertical blue, yellow and purple lines. There were also white vertical lines across the top.  Otherwise, the set worked well and had a good picture.  When I called Samsung customer service, they said their warranty does not cover damages in transit.  I explained that there were no visible cracks in the screen.  The rep said that it could be an internal crack which would also not be covered..  When I asked whether they were going to do anything about it, I was told I would have to send them a picture and go through some other hoops to determine whether the defect was covered.  While I did that I also called Amazon product support and they suggested that it should just be sent back for a refund which I am in the process of doing.  This is the first Samsung product I bought.  I plan to replace this item with a Sony product which I have always had good experience with.  Amazon customer support was great.  I got the impression that Samsung customer support was not all that customer friendly and was primarily interested in finding ways to avoid warranty obligations.

review_detail.author: A. Siegel
review_detail.title: DONT BUY IT!!!!!
review_detail.content: This tv has begun making a ticking noise from the rear. Ive owned 5 different samsung tvs all have have been great quality. This one is different.... After about 2 weeks it began making a ticking noise from the back. Usually happens at least three times a minute. At first I gave it the benefit of the doubt thinking it was just the expansion and contraction of parts warming and cooling. Or possibly The plastic on the rear creeking from being wall mounted. It is none of the above this is an audible distraction coming from inside the tv. Soo I ended up having Samsung come out to look at it. The tech heard the noise ended up having to order an entire new screen and two of the main boards. Which in just parts cost more than if they just gave me a new tv or my money back. After he replaced everything the day I got home mind you my wife has had to leave work early twice now because they only come out between 8am and 5pm monday to friday the tv is still making the clicking noise. So I called up they want to come out again to check the noise. So again my wife has to be home to have them come see it at a loss of wages to us again. The tech doesnt hear this time but ive recorded the noise and have had friends over that have heard it after all the parts were replaced. So being that the tech didnt hear it when he came out there is nothing they can do no refund nothing. After all the years ive bought Samsung products im done ive owned 5 tvs none of which do I have these issues with, 4 phones, 1 sound bar, 1 surround sound system 3 blueray players, 1 microwave and 1 dishwasher. Im done good job loosing a valued life time customer I wont buy a thing from you again. My next phone wont be manufactured by you along with every other electronic or appliance I ever own. PS Customer service and support is a nightmare I spent sometimes hours waiting on hold for a supervisor only to be hung up on.

review_detail.author: chris
review_detail.title: Beautiful TV - Design and Features
review_detail.content: This is an excellent TV.  I use it mostly for streaming movies (Amazon TV) or for gaming (Xbox One X).  If your coming from an older or cheaper 4k tv you will see a difference with the Dynamic Crystal Color and the HDR Plus.  Dont get it confused - not all HDR is created equally.  If your finally moving on from your non-4k TV, you are going to be blown away.  Even on older movies, you will start noticing colors standing out and things in the background that weren't as clear in the past.  For gamers this TV checks off every box in the Xbox One X 4k options.  Another common misconception that you can just plug a 4k TV up and get all the benefits.  My 1st 4k TV only checked off half the options, and there is a significant difference between the gaming experience.

review_detail.title: Great Picture, sound could be better.
review_detail.content: Picture was very good, especially  for the price. I purchased this after seeing the Consumer Reports review on 4K televisions.  The picture settings took a while to decipher, but following recommendations from CR (again) for each picture setting, I am very happy with the results.  Connections to apps are quick, also.  So far only Amazon Prime has 4K content that I've seen, so can't comment on the 4K picture quality yet.  The setup instructions are very poor, photocopied sheets that are hard but not impossible to follow.  The tv stand is somewhat flimsy, but I knew this from previous reviews.  It would be better to have a more robust, swiveling stand as I have with another Samsung tv.  The real downside is that the sound quality is poor, and did not know this when I bought it.  I am purchasing a sound bar to compensate.  And yes, I would buy this again.

review_detail.title: Honestly this TV is pretty awesome. It ended up being too small for ...
review_detail.content: Honestly this TV is pretty awesome. It ended up being too small for my old man eyes in my bedroom but it works great for my kids. We hooked up a chrome cast and it fits the bill perfectly.  My only complaint is the remote. It's kind of like I would expect if you went to a toy store and bought a kids "my first remote"  Its uncomfortable and the buttons require major mashing to work.  Because I use it with my streamer the only thing I use the remote for is the volume, but even that is annoying. You have great little TV here LG!  Just make a better remote and you'll be a super (5) star. Pros: Picture quality, viewable size, small footprint, sensible power adapter/source, good sound for this size unit, doesn't force unwanted smart apps on you. Cons- the remote. It's terrible.

review_detail.title: The first one was good; the second was a disaster.
review_detail.content: I bought this TV to use as monitor for one of my computers and it turned out to be OK; just OK. I bought another one for my other computer and it turned out to be a disaster. It broke down after less than a month of use. This review is for the first one.

Product: LG Electronics (22LJ4540) 22-Inch Class Full HD 1080p LED TV (2017 Model)

review_detail.author: Doc
review_detail.title: Low dynamic range and low contrast display
review_detail.content: Just OK. The display is missing the high contrast of the Samsung 19" that sits next to it, and the over-the-air antenna receiver input filters are not sharp enough to suppress interference from public service band transmitters when they are close and as a result I get video dropouts (on both the LG and the Samsung - so I presume they use the same chip without any additional filtering).  On two occasions it has turned on with no sound, only to recover it a day or two later (the Samsung had sound).  There is an uncontrollably noisy chime that sounds when power is turned on or off (I presume this is to assure that mom and dad know when the kids turn it on (or off) in the middle of the night). I will soon relegate it to an external monitor for a PC where it won't show off it's ugly side too much.

review_detail.title: Samsung does not stand behind their product.
review_detail.content: I’ve had Samsung TVs before and it has work out well. Until the latest TV I bought snapped from the base. Call, email and send pictures to Samsung. They send out repair people, was told it’s not repairable so they will have to replace it. After TWO months of weekly back and forth, being transfer from one department to the other they finally wasted my time to tell me that they can’t do anything to help and I should call the local repair people. Even though it’s their manufacturing flaw. It snapped! Will not recommended this company to anyone. Especially for the price you are paying. You would hope they would stand behind their product.

Product: Samsung 50NU7100 Flat 50” 4K UHD 7 Series Smart TV 2018

review_detail.author: Happy Costumer
review_detail.title: Great TV, Can’t Beat The Price, Top Quality!
review_detail.content: We purchased the Samsung 58” NU7100, on a Labor Day weekend sale at Best Buy; $649.00 for a 4K UHD HDR 10, Smart TV, loaded  with a bunch of apps! On our way home my wife was driving and was reading reviews on my phone about this exact model and they weren’t too pleasant to read, I told my wife, “we may have to return this tv based on other people’s reviews and experiences”. But then we decided, what the hell, we got 15 days to return this TV if it really sux, but after we opened it, we were happyly surprised with the picture & sound quality, we hooked it up to our Xfinity wireless WiFi network and it was immediately streaming content in 4K HDR from Vudu. The connectivity is super fast, our network is only 50 Mbps, now our Xfinity TV cable box X1 didn’t work, but that was because we were using a 12 year old 1.2 standard HDMI cable with Ethernet. Make sure you purchase 2.0 HDMI High Speed cables. We mounted this TV on the Fireplace with an inexpensive ($30.00) ViewPoint bracket, this TV uses four 8M 45mm screws (not supplied by Samsung), we went to Home Depot to get’em, the screws were under $5.00. this TV’s frame is thin on all 4 sides, with a black mat color finish, it looks elegant over the fire place. You don’t want this TV over a furniture, the legs that came with it look plastic and cheap, but on a wall it looks like a $3,000.00 TV but you only paid $649.00.

I would say it is picture heavy meaning the picture is very good, especially 4K but the TV is not feature heavy. You can get a Roku bx for 4k and smart remote. Or you can just add $100 to the price of this TV and see what other Samsung models are within reach. In our house, we are all Samsung because of dependability and picture. This is a good middle of the road TV

review_detail.author: Budgetbee
review_detail.title: Amazing Colors and Clear Picture
review_detail.content: The 65" NU7100 Smart 4K UHD TV is amazing! The size alone really caught me by surprise. I didn't think it would be much improvement over my 55" TV, but I was wrong. The sheer size really gives it a commanding presence in my living room. Also, the design is sleek and slim. It is the perfect addition to any TV watching room - it's the jewel of the room. The next aspect that surprised me was the sharpness and pure colors that the TV projected. I anticipated a TV of this size would not have such clear, succinct colors. It really enhanced each and every program I watched. I especially loved watching game shows, movies and reality shows on the NU7100 - they were "larger than life"! My family and friends love coming over to watch TV at my house now - they love the TV! Another amazing aspect is the smart functions. They are so convenient and easy to use. No more searching - everything is right in front of you! Not only are they easily accessible, you have access to any smart function you can imagine or need. I love that I can toggle between cable, Netflix, Amazon Video, etc. with just a few clicks on the remote. Overall, I am completely amazed with the Samsung 65" NU7100! The whole package makes it incredible: size, shape, sleekness, clearness, vivid colors and convenience.

review_detail.author: BillWhopper
review_detail.title: Only 3 HDMI Inputs on 7 Series is too few.
review_detail.content: (I bought at Best Buy) The 7 Series is the top of the line flat glass television from Samsung so it should be at the Sony XBR4 level of connectivity. I need 4 HDMI since my Samsung sound bar uses one and could use 5. The 7 Series fails on connectivity. The SmartThings app does not work (sign in does not work) so those "features" are off the table. The legs are pathetic and embarrassing, Samsung should at least offer a serious glass base as an accessory purchase, these plastic sticks are ridiculous. The back is beautiful but curved so a standard "X" mount that screws onto the back of a TV as part of a wall mount does not fit... ridiculous. Bottom line is I should be able to buy a nicer product without going to curved glass and the 7 Series should be that product.

review_detail.author: Anton
review_detail.title: Had a deal-breaking line down the picture.
review_detail.content: Bought the 65" model 65NU7100 brand new from Best Buy, less than a week ago. Got it home and hooked it up and was pretty much happy with it. However, once my family got to bed, I started watching Rogue One on it and noticed this peculiar line in the image. It was relatively unassuming, however, once I noticed it, I couldn't stop looking at it in nearly every lightly-colored scene. I thought at first, it might be possibly due to Rogue One's rendering, so I turned on World War II in Color on Netflix.... same thing. The picture I've attached to this review shows a paused overcast sky from WW2 in Color, and I tried to point out the line (the other uniform lines are simply artifacts of my phone) with arrows. It looks minor in the image, but once I saw it, I couldn't "unsee" it. It was really noticeable at night when my living room was dark. I took it back to Best Buy in less than 24 hours and received a full refund, as I was reluctant to try my luck with another.

review_detail.author: drew hoffmann
review_detail.title: Just spend the extra money and get a better TV
review_detail.content: Word to the wise, if you are thinking of getting a 4k TV above 43 inches, spend the extra money and don't by this TV or any other budget LED 4k TV.  The motion is terrible with out the Judder reduction on and when the Judder reduction is on, the picture is so choppy on most content that it is unwatchable.  The contrast ratio on this TV is pretty low and the viewing angle are laughable.  On mine, I also have terrible light bleed in the corners and gray uniformity issues.  I did not purchase mine from Amazon.  Mine was a replacement that Samsung sent to me because I had all the same issues on a Samsung 6290 tv.  Just don't buy this TV, or really any Samsung budget 4k because they really don't put that much effort into making your viewing experience high quality.

review_detail.title: Screen does not tilt and volume control is poor.

It is fixed in such a position that it catches glare from the window and 2) the volume is funky, when I turn it on or off there’s an indicator tone that blasts me out of the room, but when watching shows I have to turn it nearly full blast just to hear and even then I can’t hear it across the kitchen or with cooking going on. Now I know I don’t hear like I did when I was 20 but I’m not deaf either. There’s something not right about this volume control. I’ve had this for a couple months now and will settle for it but wish I’d returned it honestly. The picture is just sort of average. No complaints but it didn’t strike me as anything above average. The price was good though.

review_detail.author: Chad George
review_detail.title: Honestly this TV is pretty awesome. It ended up being too small for ...
review_detail.content: Honestly this TV is pretty awesome. It ended up being too small for my old man eyes in my bedroom but it works great for my kids. We hooked up a chrome cast and it fits the bill perfectly.  My only complaint is the remote. It's kind of like I would expect if you went to a toy store and bought a kids "my first remote"  Its uncomfortable and the buttons require major mashing to work.  Because I use it with my streamer the only thing I use the remote for is the volume, but even that is annoying. You have great little TV here LG!  Just make a better remote and you'll be a super (5) star. Pros: Picture quality, viewable size, small footprint, sensible power adapter/source, good sound for this size unit, doesn't force unwanted smart apps on you. Cons- the remote. It's terrible.

Product: LG Electronics 24LJ4540 24-Inch 720p LED TV (2017 Model)

review_detail.author: Doc
review_detail.title: Low dynamic range and low contrast display
review_detail.content: Just OK. The display is missing the high contrast of the Samsung 19" that sits next to it, and the over-the-air antenna receiver input filters are not sharp enough to suppress interference from public service band transmitters when they are close and as a result I get video dropouts (on both the LG and the Samsung - so I presume they use the same chip without any additional filtering).  On two occasions it has turned on with no sound, only to recover it a day or two later (the Samsung had sound).  There is an uncontrollably noisy chime that sounds when power is turned on or off (I presume this is to assure that mom and dad know when the kids turn it on (or off) in the middle of the night). I will soon relegate it to an external monitor for a PC where it won't show off it's ugly side too much.

My only complaints are: the indicator light at the bottom of the TV, a little annoying but whatever; the remote is a little cheap but it works great and is super simple; obviously the complaints about the TV not being quite as bright as other way more expensive panels will be true but I️ haven’t noticed it too much, the picture quality is amazing. review_detail.author: Nikki S.
review_detail.title: LOVE MY TCL ROKU HDR HD TV!!!!!
review_detail.content: I am in heaven. Wow. What a great TV. I was a little apprehensive about the set-up. But when it arrived l just got busy unpacking it and hoped for the best. It was a breeze to set up and get my apps logged into Roku and a few minor adjustments to the picture and l was set. Spectacular color and the sound quality is off the charts. Why would anyone need better sound? For my budget this TCL HDR TV is the bomb. Don't be fooled by all the high class brands and perks they advertise to reel in your dollars, this TV can compete with them all. Legit.

Product: TCL 55S405 55-Inch 4K Ultra HD Roku Smart LED TV (2017 Model)

review_detail.author: mark rodela
review_detail.title: A great tv for a low price.
review_detail.content: At this price, if you're in the market for a tv of this size, why would you not get this one?  Judging by the reviews, there's a small chance you could end up with a bad one, but the overall consensus is this is a great tv for the price. I'm not sure smart tv's existed before we got our last tv (a 42" Sylvania).  Watching tv on this one, I feel like we have been living in the dark ages.  I'm not a huge videophile or audiophile, but I do enjoy good video and audio and this tv certainly has both.  I haven't had it for a week yet, and I will be back if things change, but this tv has done everything very well.  Netflix, Hulu, Directv Now, Amazon and Roku TV have all worked flawlessly.  I just finished watching Dr. Strange on this tv.  Holy cow.  Amazing.  Considering there are tv's out there that cost hundreds or thousands more, I am very happy with my purchase.

Product: TCL 55S405 55-Inch 4K Ultra HD Roku Smart LED TV (2017 Model)

review_detail.author: Sam Allen
review_detail.title: Great 4k TV for the price!
review_detail.content: When I first ordered this TV and received it, we had it set up and everything but discovered on the TV screen itself non-working pixels on a black spot of the screen. I went online here and requested a replacement for it. After waiting two weeks for the TV, we got the new one and no black spots/non-working pixels on the screen, everything else about the TV was perfect. Have not spent much time with it, (this was my first 4k TV I have purchesed). Going from a older style 1080p LCD TV to a Smart TV is a worlds difference and so far I do like it. I do miss some of the older setting features on the Non-Smart TVs but its something to get use to on a TV like this. The Image quality is spectacular (only wish now to have more equipment for 4k to use its full potential!), I would say the only real downside to the TV is lack of buttons on the main remote, compared to the older TVs which had tons of button (like the cable TV remotes) but thats like half a star off. The other downside (but that was just situational) was receiving a defective TV and thats just another half star. Overall i'll say I am pretty happy with the upgrade and will get use to this type of TV.

Product: TCL 55S405 55-Inch 4K Ultra HD Roku Smart LED TV (2017 Model)

The screen is hands down the best I've seen, bright and crystal clear. The ROKU software is lightning fast and functions perfectly. If I had to choose anything I didn't like, I'd have to say the remote is small and could easily be lost. If you're contemplating buying a TCL and having reservations, take the leap, you won't be disappointed. Highly recommended product.

Product: TCL 55S405 55-Inch 4K Ultra HD Roku Smart LED TV (2017 Model)

review_detail.author: freesia3
review_detail.title: TV of the Future?
review_detail.content: This is a very good 4K HD TV especially for the price. The TV is very easy to set up. We can watch Cable/Satellite, attach an antenna or stream our favorite channels. The picture quality and sound is quite good for such a thin TV. Okay, so what are the draw backs? Well, if you get cable or satellite, the providers remote cannot be programmed to the TCL. Not too big of a deal, just have to use two remotes. Secondly, the streaming feature works well for a short period of time but after awhile. Basically, you lose the ability to view movies, tv shows, etc. We had to start removing and adding back the wi-fi to get streaming apps to work. It has something to do with the communication of the GEO locators between the streaming companies and TCL. Supposedly, there is a fix in the works but it may be awhile. So, we subscribed to Directv again  and using streaming apps on my phone/PC until it is fixed. That is why I am giving it 4 stars.

Product: TCL 55S405 55-Inch 4K Ultra HD Roku Smart LED TV (2017 Model)

review_detail.author: Amazon Customer
review_detail.title: buy it.. i wish they made it in 80 inch as well
review_detail.content: I've always skeptical of cheap stuff... But they offered a 4 year warrenty for like 35 bucks.. heres the deal. I'm not looking at it beside 10 other tvs so I can't really speak to picture quality. looks good to my eyes. cant see lag.. cant see any wierdness. What I'm impressed with besides the price Is the interface. I'm a bit of a cord cutter. no point in buying 125 buck of programing and only watching 3 channels. the over the air interface Is great. the Roku built in is awesome. you can pause live tv for about 90 seconds...I'm not sure why we haven't seen this combo until now. samsung and the other giants spend 100 of thousands developing interfaces.. guess what tcl... this is what we want. I can control it with my cell when I can't find the remote. the thing is pretty awesome. I  honestly like it much better than my 80" Vizeo. Durability I can't speak to.. But for less than 10 bucks a year they will send someone out to the house fix it where it sits or replace it. so max out of pocket is 110 bucks a year.. try that math with the 3k dollar vizio that has a dark spot 3 years old and outside the warrenty. this is the deal.. buy it with the warrenty and dont look back.. these guys talking about broken on arrival.. thats true of any tv. i bought 3 curved samsungs to use as monitors last year out of 3, 2 were broke. out of the 2 sent to replace those 1 was broken. dont sweat that stuff.. just send it back and get another. this is a soild buy.

Product: TCL 55S405 55-Inch 4K Ultra HD Roku Smart LED TV (2017 Model)

review_detail.author: Michael R - Marlton NJ
review_detail.title: 49S405 Input delay (input lag) measured
review_detail.content: I did some tests with the 49S405 and an old CRT monitor to test input delay (Input Lag).  I'm not 100% sure that I did it correctly but what i'm seeing is 40 - 50ms+ on the TV. That being said I played some Overwatch and didn't feel the delay and it didn't seem to affect my performance.  Overaqll I am happy with the TV but I am not videophile. In video games, input lag is the delay between the television or monitor receiving a signal and it being displayed on the screen.

Product: TCL 55S405 55-Inch 4K Ultra HD Roku Smart LED TV (2017 Model)

review_detail.author: Amazon Customer
review_detail.title: An "OK" picture  and a "semi-smart" TV.
review_detail.content: Eh - it's OK. Have had it for a few months now. Replaced a 4-yr old LG with failing LEDs. I find the Roku "smart" part a little constraining - as the Roku OS won't play some media file types (licensing, not a technical issue). The TV does show some weird anomalies/pixelation in the dark parts of the picture - no settings I can find gets rid of it completely; and fast motion animation is not particularly "clean" either So - it's an "OK" picture and I'd opine a "semi-smart" TV - I've had a Roku stick for years and it's great for what it is but I'm not sure I'm on board with using it as a "smart TV" OS. You can't argue with the price, though - and I'm done paying $1K for TVs which only last a few years anyway. Maybe I got a clunker - can't say. It works - but you certainly don't step back from it and say "wow"...

Product: TCL 55S405 55-Inch 4K Ultra HD Roku Smart LED TV (2017 Model)

review_detail.author: DMan
review_detail.title: I was looking for a cheap smart TV to hang in the garage and decided on ...
review_detail.content: I was looking for a cheap smart TV to hang in the garage and decided on this one. While I was not expecting much for a 400 dollar 4k TV it does work. The picture is ok and upscaling isnt the greatest, some claim to have 0 motion lag while i experience ghosting on mine. This TV also has some of the WORST clouding I have ever seen in a TV. Clouding is light bleed or patchiness randomly through out the screen. Its like edge-light bleed but not around the edges. This is most apparent in black scenes where you can see the different light levels showing through the black.

Product: TCL 55S405 55-Inch 4K Ultra HD Roku Smart LED TV (2017 Model)

review_detail.author: Kyle Inman
review_detail.title: Definitely Worth The Buy
review_detail.content: Coming from a 1080p Samsung TV, I wasn't really sure what to expect when I switched over to this relatively low-budget 4K set. I've had the TV for little over two weeks now, and I have to say that I'm pretty impressed. The picture quality straight out of the box isn't the best, with way too much oversaturated colors and an ugly level of sharpness. But when calibrated (Roku TVs don't have a lot of settings particular to picture quality, and the more advanced settings like white balance and gamma are reserved to the companion app) it looks pretty stunning. I've had no issues with the TV in terms of shipping management, nothing damaged or otherwise defective. The only downside is that there is substantial backlight bleed on the edges of the screen but it isn't obtrusive and it's something that can easily be gotten used to. I also want to talk about the Roku elements of the TV. Everything works well, there's no visible hiccups and there is no remote lag (although it's extremely particular as to where you aim the remote) which compared to my last Smart TV, is pretty great. I do have one gripe with the Roku apps though, with Netflix in particular. Many of the apps look to be running at a pretty low resolution and look relatively ugly with even highly compressed thumbnails. Even the subtitles in Netflix are pretty aliased. This isn't a big problem though, as it's only a nitpick. Despite this, the apps that I've tested for 4K streaming, Netflix, Hulu, and Vudu are all fully capable of streaming 4K, which the TV itself handles well. If you're not looking to buy and ultra expensive 4K set, this will absolutely suit your needs for a proper 4K HDR experience.

Product: TCL 55S405 55-Inch 4K Ultra HD Roku Smart LED TV (2017 Model)

review_detail.author: Nupraptor
review_detail.title: Absolutely amazing TV
review_detail.content: I selected this TV by going to Amazon and selecting TVs under $500 sorted by customer reviews. This TV has over 3,000 reviews with an average rating of 4.5 stars so it seemed like a safe bet. So far, I am not at all disappointed.

Product: TCL 55S405 55-Inch 4K Ultra HD Roku Smart LED TV (2017 Model)

review_detail.author: Edward John Dottle
review_detail.title: GET THIS TV! Best value for anyone and a good as any high priced TV I have seen. ROKU is GREAT!
review_detail.content: I was nervous about ordering this TV reading other reviews. There was no reason to be. This TV far surpassed my expectations and my wife and I love it. The sound from the TV is not bad and I hooked it up to my home theater amplifier. Nothing about this TV is poor quality and I find it to be very high quality. Installed on a support on the wall and looks very nice. The smart phone android application works great. I have Netflix and Amazon Video and I like the navigation on this better than the web interfaces for those two channels. All I can say is I am more than happy. I actually was going to get a smaller TV at 1080 resolution but the deal on this one was so good I moved my 50" Westinghouse 4K Smart TV to the bedroom. My named brand Westinghouse is junk compared to this TV. I like it better than Sony TVs and is as good as any Samsung I have seen but you save so much money. I do not even see a reason to buy any other TV. We use this in an room and is about 12' from the TV and is a very good size.

Product: TCL 55S405 55-Inch 4K Ultra HD Roku Smart LED TV (2017 Model)

review_detail.author: Michael Grey
review_detail.title: Great Picture, Bad OS
review_detail.content: I'd like to preface by saying the TV looks great and having the Roku app is amazing. However, it has many problems. Just today the home screen would not display. I would press the home button on the Roku remote and hear the sound but the screen would be black. The Netflix button worked, it displayed that app perfectly fine, but the home screen was not working. I unplugged the power cord from the TV and that seemed to reset it, so for the now the home screen is working again. The fact that nowadays even our TV's are throwing advertisements in our faces without our control is extremely frustrating to me. Part of the reason I got this TV with the Roku was to avoid as many advertisements as possible. For example, I changed my theme to something that looked decent and was free, ($1.99 for a picture in the background? Really?) but recently my theme was mysteriously changed to a Game of Thrones theme which isn't even in the theme store so it couldn't have been me or anyone else. Additionally, there's always an advertisement on the right side of the screen on the home page, and you can guess what it was advertising when my theme was magically changed. That being said, the quality and size of the screen is outstanding, and the personalization settings are very convenient. Overall it's a good deal, though I don't agree that Roku is a cable box replacement.

Product: TCL 55S405 55-Inch 4K Ultra HD Roku Smart LED TV (2017 Model)

review_detail.author: R. McClusky
review_detail.title: Buy It! Excellent value.
review_detail.content: This inexpensive 4K SmartTV is superb. Options and settings are more than adequate, nice operational features with streaming content, auto switching of input source,easy to set up, beautiful image and pretty decent sound. The remote is nice and small, @ 5”L x 1½”W x 1”T. The only thing I deducted a star for is the remote is an infrared direct signal. You must point it at center bottom of TV and be no more than 8’ away, a minor incovenience. Bottom line, you can spend more, get some extra features you’ll never use, have a big name brand and you won’t get more bang for your buck. This TV is very nicely priced and you get real value for your money.

Product: TCL 55S405 55-Inch 4K Ultra HD Roku Smart LED TV (2017 Model)

review_detail.author: Jack C
review_detail.title: Great TV for an unbelievable price.
review_detail.content: Like everyone else, I was a bit leery of a 55" 4K TV at this price, but decided to take the gamble based on the excellent reviews.  And I'm very glad I did.  My only complaint is that it took a bit longer to arrive than planned - maybe a week beyond the last "estimated delivery date", but it was worth the wait.  It arrived from Amazon (which is great because I don't have a pickup and it's too big to fit in the car), and all I had to do was attach the two feet (the screws are very long, I'd recommend a drill with a screwdriver bit).  It walks you through the setup, you enter your router password - and it actually allows you to see what you've typed in so you can double-check it before hitting enter - a welcome feature these days.  Then you can go into Netflix and enter your password, your Amazon streaming, etc.  You plug your devices in and choose a description for each (Blu ray player, game console, etc.) and that's about it.

Product: TCL 55S405 55-Inch 4K Ultra HD Roku Smart LED TV (2017 Model)

review_detail.author: Derek Jensen
review_detail.title: Fantastic if it lasts
review_detail.content: Fantastic bargain for a 55-inch 4K TV. Light-weight and easy to set up. The only problem I had was getting the Roku stuff to play thru my receiver. There is sparse documentation, but a lot of googling and experimentation finally got me what I needed. It turns out you have to connect the HDMI cable to the HDMI 1 input, which is labeled "ARC"; that's the "audio return channel" connection. The other end needs to go into an ARC monitor port on the receiver. My Onkyo has "main" and "sub" monitor ports, and only the main one is compatible (the other goes to my projector, so it doesn't matter). I then had to turn on the RIHD function in my receiver settings. Along the way, I set the TV to not play audio thru its own speakers.

Product: TCL 55S405 55-Inch 4K Ultra HD Roku Smart LED TV (2017 Model)

review_detail.author: brian
review_detail.title: Buy this TV
review_detail.content: Absolutely the best bang for the buck TV on the market you could possibly buy. The TV has an LED panel and is LED full-array back lit as well. That combined with its 4k HDR support makes it have one of the best image quality screens you can get second to OLED and MicroLED screens (which cost multiple thousands of dollars). It's remote is simple and easy to use, although it does NOT have a headphone jack on the remote for those of you looking for it. It streams very well and I have tested it extensively on both Netflix and Sling. For you nerds out there, yes it does support 4:4:4 chroma subsampleing and 60hz output. I've noticed some people have had issues with the 120hz output as I think that is simulated and not actually 120hz. 60hz is completely supported and looks fantastic paired with a PS4 Pro, Xbox One S or X, or a gaming PC. The star of the show here though is the Roku interface. This is what really makes this TV shine. It is turns on fast, operates very smoothly, and just works without any major issues. I have a Samsung SU8000 series Smart TV. I can say without a doubt that the TCL's Roku interface beats the Samsung's smart interface by a mile. The programmers of this Roku interface did an amazing job as it supports 4k HDR streaming flawlessly, and little touches like being able to change the theme of your TV really go a long way for the user experience. Assuming you have a fast enough internet connect that isn't throttled, both its WiFi and its weird performance has worked for me without any issues with a good amount of distance and walls between it and the router.

review_detail.author: Glenn
review_detail.title: Excellent entry-level 55" 4k set with HDR
review_detail.content: I purchased the TCL 55S405 because it was the cheapest 55" set with HDR (HDR10) that I could find at the time and while I was tempted by the P-series model (55P607) I did not need the fancier remote (nice to have but the Roku app can do what it can do), Dolby HDR (there's barely any HDR content out there at all as-is and most of it worth watching is priced at a heavy premium), or local dimming (nice, but not worth the $200 price premium for me). I have generally been very pleased with it and the picture is excellent. 4k/HDR content that I tested through YouTube looks great, although at this point in time the amount of 4k content and especially HDR content out there is limited. Hopefully both will see more mainstream adoption and more content will become available in time. The only real letdowns I have had with my TCL 55S405 are that mine shipped with a single dead pixel (not worth the hassle of a return or warranty claim, especially since it is unnoticeable with normal viewing and only really visible within about 3 feet of the TV) and that the built-in YouTube app is much glitchier than the one I'm used to on my Roku Premiere (it skips the first second of audio on every video, the app crashes the TV once in a while, and audio skips badly on certain music-only videos), although it works pretty well 95% of the time. Otherwise, the built in Roku platform is amazing and leaps and bounds better than any other smart OS out there and performs flawlessly. If you're buying a smart TV for the built-in smart features, this is the cream of the crop.

review_detail.author: TCB
review_detail.title: Exceptional Value
review_detail.content: OK. I am going to give this TV 5 stars for now. But I've only had it for a month so I can't comment on long-term durability/dependability. I am stunned by the value here. For the price, I was ready to be disappointed, but this is a really first class user experience. I did not try to mount my TV. I just used the included legs to put it on my entertainment console. Set up was a breeze....much easier than the more expensive brand-name sets I have owned. The illumination seems even and is sufficiently bright. I am not an expert on black levels, etc. The blacks look black to me, and the picture in general is as good as my other set from a a better known brand (which cost $1500). I really like the integration of streaming services. I know other brands do this, but TCL has done a great job. With the exception of Apple TV, I have all of my services in one place.....and I could of course add Apple TV as an external device. Kudos to TCL for whatever they are doing.....jamming this much goodness into their sets at a great price.

review_detail.author: Goober
review_detail.title: It has a little bit of difficulty picking up the IR signal from the remote, especially at an angle.
review_detail.content: With a little ingenuity, you can improve your television's ability to pick up the IR (infra-red) signal from your remote.  If you notice, the sensor is a flat pice of clear plastic under the TCL label.  For whatever reason, the sensor doesn't pick up the IR too well when the remote is aimed from an angle in front of the set.  Knowing that IR reflects off of aluminum foil quite well, you can do so mething to fix this problem.  Just form some foil around a bent piece of cardboard, and place it under and a little behind the sensor.  You should notice a dramatic improvement - no more missed button presses.  If you are mounting the TV on a wall, you could try taping a piece of foil just behind the sensor - let it hang down & curl the bottom toward you a bit so some of the IR bounces up into the sensor.

review_detail.author: AmazonUser987654321
review_detail.title: 2017 Model with HDR, Fast Apps, Awesome Features and Great Price
review_detail.content: I'm really happy with this TV. I don't write reviews often but this TV deserves it. It's the summer 2017 model so it has HDR now which gives you a more vibrant, dynamic color range as well as better black levels. I've used it for about a week now and TV shows like Gotham do a great job showing how well the HDR handles dark scenes. I've played upscaled PS3 games, PS4 games at 1080p look stunning, I look forward to trying an Xbox One X on it. My only complaint is that the 4K videos on Youtube can supposedly work but if I bring up the "Stats for Nerds" it shows that Optimal Resolution is 3840x2160 but the best it'll stream at is 1920x1080 even with a full 60 seconds of buffer. I'm only on 20 meg DSL but with that good of a buffer the 4K should work. Any help on that TCL? As far as picture quality, it's fantastic. I've seen models for double the price that aren't much better. The text is so sharp, I can't see individual pixels even from my 3 foot viewing distance in bed. Brightness levels are very high, I had to put it in Dark mode for nighttime viewing. Colors are very vibrant and can be customized, I dropped the Contrast and Saturation from 100 to 90 and like that look.

Product: TCL 55S405 55-Inch 4K Ultra HD Roku Smart LED TV (2017 Model)

review_detail.author: Cynthia McElhatten
review_detail.title: WOW DO I LOVE MY TCL TV!
review_detail.content: Love it!! This is my first big, flat screen, smart TV and I couldn't be happier! I spent some time learning what I should look for in this up grade. I then compared prices at Walmart, Best Buy and Amazon. I found Amazon Prime with free shipping to be the best price. I had been using a ROKU with my old TV so I was familiar with working with it. It arrived at my door and it was heavy but not too heavy for this under 5 ft. 60 year old woman. I gently scooted it across the floor to where I wanted it. I was able to tip the box and slid the TV out and could handle it easily from there. Once I had it plugged in, it did most everything itself!! Picture quality is excellent and the 55 in size was perfect for my room size and I can be in the kitchen and watch it too. Sound is just that. If you want something theater quality you will have to buy a sound system. I am using a 2006 3-2-1 Bose. You just use a cable with red & yellow connector (with a headphone jack on the other end) that goes to the Bose and plug that into your headphone jack in the TV! My Bose does not have HDMI. I was very impressed with the ease of setting up, the price, and the quality of this TV. I have had it now for close to 4 weeks. I do not anticipate any problems but will post them if they arise. I am also impressed with the remote for this TV. Very simple. Also in the ease of access to ROKU and AMAZON channels. Once you set up your account you can buy or rent movies, series, and channels right thru your amazon prime with ease. I would not hesitate for one minute to buy this TV again.
